ground_truth: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are seated on a train when suddenly they are fired on, and Arthur and others approach. The lady appears at their door, and Ron sees he hasn't enough money as Cho Chan walks up to the trolley. Harry and Cho look at each other and smile. Hermione sees Harry rubbing his head. Four flying horses pulling a carriage land at Hogwarts, and the crowds cheer. A large ship emerges from under the water and approaches too. A man runs up the aisle limping comically, whispers to Dumbledore, and leaves the same way. A group of girls dressed in blue dance up the aisle and release butterflies, bow, and everyone applauds. A series of older boys walk up the aisle, brandishing bo staffs with sparks, and breathe fire. They embrace. The man seated next to Hagrid yelps when Hagrid stabs a fork into his hand. A strange man stands in the doorway, casts magic upwards to seal the roof, and peace is restored. This character enters the room and begins walking, seeing Harry through his mechanical eye. He limps, breathing heavily as the crowd is unsettled and booing. Dumbledore casts magic over a box which melds into a goblet containing a blue flame. A suspicious character enters the room where the goblet burns and closes the door. He writes his name on the board as Mad-Eye throws the chalk in anger, pops open a jar with a spider, and uses his wand to send it around the class, unsettling them. Draco laughs, and Mad-Eye sends the spider onto Draco's face. Mad-Eye has the spider over a bucket of water, and it's wriggling as Neville Longbottom stands. Mad-Eye begins torturing the spider with magic, it squeals, and Mad-Eye stops. Neville is disturbed, and Mad-Eye picks up the spider, which is still making a noise. Hermione shakes her head as Mad-Eye casts a spell and the spider disintegrates. He approaches Harry's desk and takes a drink. They see a boy on the stairs facing the window, and Mad-Eye approaches Neville, patting him on the shoulder. Neville nods. Older students place their names into the flame, and others applaud, with Cedric among them. The twins come up cheering, jump inside the age line, do a high-five after putting their names into the flame, but are flung across the room when the flame fires up. When they get up, they have full heads of grey hair and beards.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are positioned on a railcar when abruptly they are attacked, and Arthur and others arrive. The woman appears at their entrance, and Ron observes he hasn't sufficient currency as Cho Chan approaches the cart. Harry and Cho gaze at each other and grin. Hermione observes Harry massaging his head. Four airborne stallions pulling a coach descend at Hogwarts, and the throngs cheer. A large vessel surfaces from beneath the water and nears too. A man dashes up the passage hobbling ridiculously, murmurs to Dumbledore, and departs the same way. A group of maidens dressed in azure perform up the passage and release butterflies, bow, and everyone claps. A succession of older lads stride up the passage, flourishing bo staffs with sparks, and exhale fire. They hug. The man positioned adjacent to Hagrid yelps when Hagrid jabs a prong into his hand. An unusual man stands in the entryway, conjures magic upwards to seal the ceiling, and tranquility is restored. This figure enters the chamber and starts moving, seeing Harry through his mechanical eye. He hobbles, wheezing as the throng is agitated and hissing. Dumbledore conjures magic over a box which melds into a chalice containing a blue blaze. A dubious figure enters the chamber where the chalice burns and shuts the door. He inscribes his name on the board as Mad-Eye hurls the chalk in rage, pops open a jar with an arachnid, and employs his wand to send it around the class, unsettling them. Draco chuckles, and Mad-Eye sends the arachnid onto Draco's visage. Mad-Eye has the arachnid over a pail of water, and it's squirming as Neville Longbottom rises. Mad-Eye begins tormenting the arachnid with magic, it squeaks, and Mad-Eye ceases. Neville is perturbed, and Mad-Eye picks up the arachnid, which is still making a noise. Hermione shakes her head as Mad-Eye utters a spell and the arachnid disintegrates. He approaches Harry's desk and takes a sip. They observe a lad on the stairs facing the pane, and Mad-Eye approaches Neville, patting him on the shoulder. Neville nods. Older scholars insert their names into the blaze, and others applaud, with Cedric among them. The twins come up cheering, leap inside the age boundary, do a high-five after placing their names into the blaze, but are hurled across the room when the blaze erupts. When they arise, they have full heads of grey locks and beards.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are seated on a train when, suddenly, shots are fired at them, and Arthur and others approach. The door is opened by the lady, and Ron notices he hasn't enough money as Cho Chang approaches the trolley. Harry and Cho look at each other and exchange smiles. Harry's head is seen being rubbed by Hermione. At Hogwarts, a carriage pulled by four flying horses lands, and cheers are given by the crowds. From under the water, a large ship emerges and approaches too. Up the aisle runs a man limping comically, who whispers to Dumbledore and exits the same way. A group of girls, dressed in blue, dances up the aisle, releases butterflies, bows, and applause is given by everyone. Up the aisle walks a series of older boys, brandishing bo staffs with sparks, while fire is breathed by them. They embrace. The man seated next to Hagrid yelps when his hand is stabbed by Hagrid with a fork. In the doorway stands a strange man, who casts magic upwards to seal the roof, and peace is restored. The room is entered by this character who begins walking, seeing Harry through his mechanical eye. He limps, breathing heavily as the crowd boos and becomes unsettled. Magic is cast by Dumbledore over a box, which melds into a goblet containing a blue flame. Into the room where the goblet burns enters a suspicious character and closes the door. His name is written on the board by Mad-Eye, who throws the chalk in anger, pops open a jar with a spider, and sends it around the class using his wand, unsettling them. Draco laughs, and the spider is sent onto Draco's face by Mad-Eye. The spider, held over a bucket of water by Mad-Eye, wriggles as Neville Longbottom stands. The spider begins being tortured with magic by Mad-Eye, it squeals, and the torture is stopped by Mad-Eye. Neville is disturbed, and Mad-Eye picks up the spider, which continues making a noise. Her head is shaken by Hermione as a spell is cast by Mad-Eye, disintegrating the spider. Harry's desk is approached by him, and a drink is taken. A boy is seen on the stairs facing the window, and Neville is approached by Mad-Eye, who pats him on the shoulder. A nod is given by Neville. Their names are placed into the flame by older students, and applause is given by others, with Cedric among them. Cheering, the twins come up, jump inside the age line, do a high-five after putting their names into the flame, but the flame fires up and flings them across the room. When they get up, full heads of grey hair and beards are on them.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are on a train when they are suddenly attacked, and Arthur arrives. Ron realizes he lacks money as Cho Chang approaches the trolley. Harry and Cho exchange smiles while Hermione sees Harry rubbing his head. Four flying horses pull a carriage to Hogwarts to cheering crowds, and a large ship surfaces. A limping man whispers to Dumbledore and departs. Girls in blue dance, release butterflies, and are applauded. Older boys with bo staffs breathe fire, then embrace. Beside Hagrid, a man yelps when stabbed by a fork. A strange man enters, casts magic to seal the roof, calming the room, and uses a mechanical eye to see Harry. Limpy and breathing heavily, the man unsettles the booing crowd. Dumbledore casts a spell on a box that turns into a goblet with a blue flame. A suspicious character enters, where the goblet burns, and writes his name as Mad-Eye hurls chalk angrily. He uses a wand to send a spider around, unsettling the class. Draco laughs, so Mad-Eye sends the spider at Draco's face, then tortures it with magic, making it squeal. Disturbed, Neville watches as Mad-Eye disintegrates the spider. He approaches Harry's desk, taking a drink. Mad-Eye pats Neville's shoulder, who nods. Older students, including Cedric, place names into the flame, receiving applause. The twins attempt, are flung back by the flame, and emerge with grey hair and beards.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione sit on a train when they're suddenly attacked, and Arthur and others arrive. A woman appears, and Ron realizes he's out of money as Cho Chan approaches the trolley. Harry and Cho exchange smiles. Hermione sees Harry massaging his head. Four flying horses land at Hogwarts, cheered by crowds, as a ship emerges from water. A man limps comically up the aisle, whispers to Dumbledore, and exits. Girls in blue release butterflies, bow, and receive applause. Older boys brandish sparking bo staffs and breathe fire. A man beside Hagrid yelps when Hagrid stabs his hand with a fork. A strange man stands in the doorway, performs magic to seal the roof, restoring peace. This character, limping and breathing heavily, enters, sees Harry through his mechanical eye, unsettling the booing crowd. Dumbledore casts magic on a box, transforming it into a goblet with a blue flame. A suspicious man enters, closes the door, writes his name, and Mad-Eye throws chalk in anger, sends a spider around the class, unsettling them. Draco laughs, and the spider is sent onto his face. Mad-Eye dangles the spider over water, tortures it with magic, stops when Neville Longbottom stands. He picks up the squealing spider, disintegrates it, approaches Harry's desk, and drinks. A boy is seen on stairs, and Mad-Eye approaches Neville, patting his shoulder. Neville nods. Older students place names into the flame, applauded by others, including Cedric. The twins cheer, jump inside the age line, high-five, but are flung back with grey hair and beards when the flame erupts.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are comfortably seated together on a train when, without warning, they find themselves the target of sudden gunfire, prompting Arthur and a group of others to approach them quickly and with concern. At that moment, a lady appears in the doorway of their compartment, capturing the attention of Ron, who suddenly realizes he doesn't have enough money as Cho Chang, with her usual grace, walks up to the trolley. Harry and Cho exchange a glance that is filled with warmth and mutual recognition, each smiling subtly. Hermione, observing her friend closely, notices that Harry is rubbing his head as if in discomfort or deep thought. Meanwhile, at Hogwarts, a spectacular sight unfolds as four majestic flying horses land, skillfully pulling a grand carriage, to the delight of cheering onlookers. Not far from this scene, a large and impressive ship emerges dramatically from beneath the water's surface, making its way forward. As these events occur, a man rushes up the aisle of the venue with a comedic limp; he quickly whispers something to Dumbledore before retreating in the same humorous fashion. As if part of a grand performance, a group of girls, elegantly dressed in blue, dances gracefully up the aisle and enchantingly releases a flurry of butterflies into the air, delighting the crowd, who respond with applause. Subsequently, a series of older boys follow, walking with purpose up the aisle while brandishing bo staffs that emit bright sparks, before demonstrating an impressive feat of breathing fire, to which the onlookers respond with enthusiasm, embracing the spectacle. Meanwhile, the man seated next to the towering Hagrid yelps in shock when Hagrid accidentally stabs a fork into his own hand. Amidst the hubbub, a strange man stands intimidatingly in the doorway; he casts a spell upwards, which effectively seals the roof with magic, and in doing so, restores order and calm. This enigmatic character then strides into the room, taking in his surroundings while catching sight of Harry through his mechanical eye. He moves with a heavy limp, breathing laboriously, unsettling the crowd, which begins to boo. Dumbledore then casts an intricate spell over a box, transforming it seamlessly into a goblet that brims with a mesmerizing blue flame. Later, a mysterious and suspicious figure enters the room where the goblet burns, carefully closing the door behind him. He proceeds to write his name on the board; at the same moment, Mad-Eye, evidently frustrated, throws the chalk in anger, and then opens a jar containing a spider, which he sends scuttling around the class with the aid of his wand, creating a ripple of unease among the students. Draco, finding humor in the situation, laughs, prompting Mad-Eye to direct the spider onto Draco's face, causing further disturbance. Mad-Eye then dangles the spider precariously over a bucket of water, as the creature wriggles helplessly, with Neville Longbottom rising to his feet in anxiety. Mad-Eye commences a series of torturous spells on the spider, and its tormented squeals fill the room until he finally ceases. A visibly disturbed Neville watches as Mad-Eye picks up the still-noisy spider. Hermione, witnessing the scene, shakes her head in disapproval as Mad-Eye casts a final spell that disintegrates the spider into nothingness. He then purposefully approaches Harry's desk and takes a deliberate sip from his flask. As events unfold, they observe a boy standing on the stairs, gazing thoughtfully out of the window, and Mad-Eye approaches Neville, offering a reassuring pat on the shoulder, to which Neville responds with a nod of acknowledgment. Meanwhile, older students step forward to place their names into the enigmatic flame, earning applause from their peers, with Cedric among them. The twins, exuberant and full of energy, come up cheering loudly. They leap spiritedly inside the age line and jubilantly high-five each other after submitting their names into the flame, but are comically flung across the room when the flame suddenly fires up. When they eventually rise to their feet, they amusingly discover that they now sport full heads of grey hair and long beards, much to the delight and laughter of those around them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Harry, Ron, and Hermione are comfortably seated together on a train, enjoying their journey when, without any warning whatsoever, they unexpectedly find themselves the target of sudden and alarming gunfire. This unexpected event prompts Arthur, accompanied by a group of others, to approach them quickly and with a palpable sense of concern. At precisely that moment, a lady makes her appearance in the doorway of their compartment, capturing the attention of Ron. He suddenly realizes, with some dismay, that he doesn't have enough money, just as Cho Chang, with her usual grace and elegance, walks up to the trolley. In this moment, Harry and Cho exchange a meaningful glance, filled with warmth and mutual recognition, each offering the other a subtle smile. Meanwhile, Hermione, observing her friend closely, notices that Harry is rubbing his head as if he is in discomfort or deep contemplation. 

Meanwhile, back at Hogwarts, a truly spectacular sight unfolds as four majestic and powerful flying horses skillfully land, gracefully pulling a grand carriage to the delight of cheering onlookers. Not far from this awe-inspiring scene, a large and impressive ship emerges dramatically from beneath the water's surface, making its majestic way forward. As these captivating events occur, a man rushes up the aisle of the venue with a comedic limp, quickly whispering something to Dumbledore before retreating in the same amusing fashion. As if part of a grand performance, a group of girls, elegantly dressed in vibrant blue, dance gracefully up the aisle, enchantingly releasing a flurry of butterflies into the air, which delights the crowd and prompts them to respond with enthusiastic applause. Subsequently, a series of older boys follows, walking with purpose up the aisle while brandishing bo staffs that emit brilliant bright sparks. They then demonstrate an impressive feat of breathing fire, to which the onlookers respond with enthusiasm, eagerly embracing the spectacle.

Meanwhile, the man seated next to the towering Hagrid yelps in shock when Hagrid inadvertently stabs a fork into his own hand. Amidst the hubbub and commotion, a strange man stands intimidatingly in the doorway; he casts a spell upwards, which effectively and efficiently seals the roof with strong magic, restoring order and quiet calm to the room. This enigmatic character then strides purposefully into the room, taking in his surroundings while catching sight of Harry through his unique mechanical eye. He moves with a noticeable heavy limp, breathing laboriously, unsettling the crowd, which begins to boo in disapproval. Dumbledore then casts an intricate and elaborate spell over a box, transforming it seamlessly into a goblet that brims with a mesmerizing and captivating blue flame. Later, a mysterious and suspicious figure enters the room where the goblet continues to burn, carefully and quietly closing the door behind him. He proceeds to write his name on the board; at the same moment, Mad-Eye, evidently frustrated, throws the chalk in anger, and then opens a jar containing a spider. He sends the spider scuttling around the class with the aid of his wand, creating a ripple of unease and discomfort among the students.

Draco, finding humor in the distressing situation, laughs, prompting Mad-Eye to direct the spider onto Draco's face, causing further disturbance and chaos. Mad-Eye then dangles the spider precariously over a bucket of water as the creature wriggles helplessly, with Neville Longbottom rising to his feet in anxiety and concern. Mad-Eye commences a series of torturous spells on the spider, and its tormented squeals fill the room until he finally ceases his actions. A visibly disturbed Neville watches as Mad-Eye picks up the still-noisy spider. Hermione, witnessing the unsettling scene, shakes her head in disapproval and dismay as Mad-Eye casts a final spell that disintegrates the spider into nothingness. He then purposefully approaches Harry's desk and takes a deliberate sip from his flask.

As events continue to unfold, they observe a boy standing thoughtfully on the stairs, gazing pensively out of the window. Mad-Eye approaches Neville, offering a reassuring pat on the shoulder, to which Neville responds with a nod of acknowledgment. Meanwhile, older students step forward to place their names into the enigmatic and mysterious flame, earning applause and admiration from their peers, with Cedric among them. The twins, exuberant and full of energetic spirit, come up cheering loudly. They leap spiritedly inside the age line and jubilantly high-five each other after submitting their names into the flame, but are comically flung across the room when the flame suddenly fires up. When they eventually rise to their feet, they amusingly discover that they now sport full heads of grey hair and long beards, much to the delight and laughter of those gathered around them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are comfortably seated on a train, engaged in their own quiet activities, when the tranquility is abruptly shattered as they are unexpectedly fired upon, causing a jolt and a stir. In response to the chaos, Arthur and others swiftly approach their location, their demeanor urgent and alert. Just then, a lady makes her appearance at their compartment door, catching their attention. Ron, in a flustered moment of realization, checks his pockets and discovers he lacks enough money, all while Cho Chang gracefully walks up to the trolley. At this moment, Harry and Cho's eyes meet, and they exchange a gentle, mutual smile that conveys a warm acknowledgment. Concurrently, Hermione notices Harry rubbing his head, a gesture suggesting he's in some discomfort or deep in thought. Meanwhile, as the scene shifts to Hogwarts, four majestic flying horses elegantly descend from the sky, pulling a carriage and landing smoothly, sparking a wave of cheers from the excited crowds gathered to witness the spectacle. Amidst this excitement, a large ship dramatically emerges from beneath the water, its approach adding to the grandeur of the scene. Suddenly, a man appears, running up the aisle with a peculiar, comical limp, making his way directly to Dumbledore. He leans in to whisper something presumably important into Dumbledore's ear before departing in the same humorous manner. Following this, a group of girls clad in elegant blue attire dance their way up the aisle with fluid grace, releasing a flurry of butterflies into the air as they bow to the audience, who respond with enthusiastic applause. Next, a series of older boys proceed up the aisle, brandishing bo staffs that emit sparks, creating a dazzling display as they breathe fire and, with camaraderie, embrace one another. As the festivities continue, a man seated next to Hagrid unexpectedly yelps in shock and pain when Hagrid accidentally stabs a fork into his hand. Amidst the commotion, a strange man stands imposingly in the doorway, casting a spell upwards that effectively seals the roof, restoring peace to the chaotic atmosphere. This intriguing character then enters the room, moving with purpose as he walks, his mechanical eye swiveling to lock onto Harry. As he limps and breathes heavily, the crowd's mood turns restless, and some begin to boo. In a display of control and focus, Dumbledore casts a spell over a box, which seamlessly melds into a goblet that ignites with a mesmerizing blue flame. In an atmosphere thick with anticipation, a suspicious character quietly enters the room where the goblet burns brightly, closing the door behind him. He proceeds to write his name on the board with deliberate strokes, simultaneously with Mad-Eye Moody, who in a fit of irritation throws the chalk in anger. Not stopping there, he pops open a jar containing a spider and uses his wand to set it in motion around the classroom, deliberately unsettling the students. The tension is palpable, and when Draco chuckles with amusement, Mad-Eye directs the spider onto Draco's face, escalating the tension further. As Mad-Eye holds the spider over a bucket of water, it wriggles in distress while Neville Longbottom stands visibly tense. With a cold determination, Mad-Eye uses his wand to torture the spider with magic, making it squeal in agony before he finally ceases. Neville appears visibly disturbed by the ordeal, prompting Mad-Eye to pick up the spider, which continues to make distressed noises. Hermione, with disapproval, shakes her head in response to Mad-Eye's actions. Mad-Eye then casts a spell, causing the spider to disintegrate into nothingness. He makes his way to Harry's desk, casually taking a sip from his drink as the classroom returns to a semblance of normalcy. This shift in focus reveals a boy standing on the stairs, facing the window, lost in thought. Mad-Eye approaches Neville, giving him a reassuring pat on the shoulder, and Neville responds with a nod, signifying his understanding or acceptance. Meanwhile, older students eagerly place their names into the blue flame, met with applause from their peers, with Cedric being among these participants. The Weasley twins, filled with excitement and mischief, come up cheering exuberantly. They deliberately jump inside the designated age line, executing a jubilant high-five after submitting their names into the flame. However, their antics backfire spectacularly as the flame erupts, flinging them across the room. They land with a thud, and as they get up, they find themselves humorously transformed, sporting full heads of grey hair and long beards, much to the amusement and surprise of those around them.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Harry, Ron, and Hermione are seated on a train when they are suddenly confronted by Arthur and others after being fired upon. As Cho Chan approaches the trolley, Ron notices he lacks money, and Harry and Cho exchange smiles. Meanwhile, Hermione observes Harry rubbing his head. Upon arriving at Hogwarts, four flying horses pull a carriage to land amidst cheering crowds, while a large ship surfaces and approaches the shore. A man limps comically up the aisle to whisper to Dumbledore before exiting. A group of girls in blue performs a dance, releasing butterflies to applause, followed by older boys showcasing fire-breathing and sparking bo staff skills. During this, Hagrid accidentally stabs his neighbor's hand with a fork, causing a yelp.

A strange man stands in the doorway, casting magic to repair the ceiling, bringing peace. He then enters, revealing himself as Mad-Eye, and unnerves the crowd as he limps and breathes heavily, his mechanical eye spotting Harry. Dumbledore magically reveals a goblet with a blue flame. A suspicious character enters, closes the door, and observes as Mad-Eye conducts a lesson, unsettling the class by using magic to manipulate a spider. Draco laughs, prompting Mad-Eye to retaliate by sending the spider onto Draco's face. Mad-Eye tortures the spider with magic, causing distress to Neville Longbottom before disintegrating the spider and taking a drink at Harry's desk. He comforts Neville with a pat on the shoulder. 

Older students, including Cedric, place their names into the flame to applause. The twins attempt the same, crossing the age line and high-fiving after their submission, but are humorously flung across the room when the flame reacts, leaving them with full heads of grey hair and beards.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are seated on the Hogwarts Express, the iconic train that transports students to the magical school, when suddenly they are fired on, and Arthur Weasley, a member of the Order of the Phoenix, and others approach. The lady, known as the trolley witch who provides snacks to students, appears at their door, and Ron realizes he hasn't enough money as Cho Chang, a student from Ravenclaw house, walks up to the trolley. Harry and Cho look at each other and smile, hinting at their mutual attraction. Hermione sees Harry rubbing his head, possibly from a recent scar-related pain. Four flying horses, which are winged creatures known as Thestrals, pulling a carriage land at Hogwarts, and the crowds cheer, anticipating the arrival of students from Beauxbatons Academy of Magic. A large ship emerges from under the water, a Durmstrang Institute's mode of magical transportation, and approaches too. A man, limping comically and known for his energetic entrances, runs up the aisle to whisper to Dumbledore, the revered headmaster of Hogwarts, and leaves the same way. A group of girls dressed in the sky-blue uniforms of Beauxbatons Academy dance up the aisle and release butterflies as part of their enchanting introduction, bow, and everyone applauds. A series of older boys, representing Durmstrang Institute, walk up the aisle, brandishing bo staffs sparking with enchantments, and breathe fire, demonstrating their skills in martial magic. They embrace in camaraderie. The man seated next to Hagrid, Hogwarts' gamekeeper who is half-giant, yelps when Hagrid accidentally stabs a fork into his hand, highlighting Hagrid's characteristic lack of finesse. A strange man stands in the doorway, casting magic upwards to seal the roof, and peace is restored. This character, Mad-Eye Moody, known for his magical prosthetic eye granting him 360-degree vision, enters the room and begins walking, seeing Harry through his mechanical eye. He limps, breathing heavily as the crowd is unsettled and booing due to his imposing presence. Dumbledore casts magic over a box, which transforms into the Goblet of Fire, a mystical artifact that selects champions for the Triwizard Tournament, and it contains a blue flame. A suspicious character enters the room where the goblet burns and closes the door. He writes his name on the board as Mad-Eye throws the chalk in anger, expressing his frustration, pops open a jar with a spider, and uses his wand to send it around the class, unsettling them. Draco Malfoy, a Slytherin known for his arrogance, laughs, and Mad-Eye sends the spider onto Draco's face, teaching him a lesson. Mad-Eye has the spider over a bucket of water, and it's wriggling as Neville Longbottom, a student known for his clumsiness but also bravery, stands. Mad-Eye begins torturing the spider with magic, it squeals in distress, and Mad-Eye stops, demonstrating the effects of the unforgivable curses. Neville is disturbed, and Mad-Eye picks up the spider, which is still making a noise. Hermione shakes her head in disapproval as Mad-Eye casts a spell and the spider disintegrates, emphasizing the harsh realities of dark magic. He approaches Harry's desk and takes a drink from his hip flask, rumored to contain Polyjuice Potion. They see a boy on the stairs facing the window, and Mad-Eye approaches Neville, patting him on the shoulder, trying to reassure him. Neville nods, although still shaken. Older students place their names into the flame, hoping to be selected as champions, and others applaud, with Cedric Diggory, a respected student from Hufflepuff, among them. The Weasley twins come up cheering, mischievously attempting to bypass the age restriction, jump inside the age line, do a high-five after putting their names into the flame, but are flung across the room when the flame fires up, enforcing the magical boundary. When they get up, they have full heads of grey hair and beards, a humorous consequence of their failed attempt.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Harry Ron and Hermione are seated on a train when suddenly they are fired on and Arthur and others approach. The lady appears at their door and Ron sees he has not enough money as Cho Chan walks up to the trolley. Harry and Cho look at each other and smile. Hermione sees Harry rubbing his head. Four flying horses pulling a carriage land at Hogwarts and the crowds cheer. A large ship emerges from under the water and approaches too. A man runs up the aisle limping comically whispers to Dumbledore and leaves the same way. A group of girls dressed in blue dance up the aisle and release butterflies bow and everyone applauds. A series of older boys walk up the aisle brandishing bo staffs with sparks and breathe fire. They embrace. The man seated next to Hagrid yelps when Hagrid stabs a fork into his hand. A strange man stands in the doorway casts magic upwards to seal the roof and peace is restored. This character enters the room and begins walking seeing Harry through his mechanical eye. He limps breathing heavily as the crowd is unsettled and booing. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Dumbledore casts magic over a box which melds into a goblet containing a blue flame. A suspicious character enters the room where the goblet burns and closes the door. He writes his name on the board as MadEye throws the chalk in anger pops open a jar with a spider and uses his wand to send it around the class unsettling them. Draco laughs and MadEye sends the spider onto Draco's face. MadEye has the spider over a bucket of water and it is wriggling as Neville Longbottom stands. MadEye begins torturing the spider with magic. it squeals and MadEye stops. Neville is disturbed and MadEye picks up the spider which is still making a noise. Hermione shakes her head as MadEye casts a spell and the spider disintegrates. He approaches Harry's desk and takes a drink. They see a boy on the stairs facing the window and MadEye approaches Neville patting him on the shoulder. Neville nods. Older students place their names into the flame and others applaud with Cedric among them. The twins come up cheering jump inside the age line do a highfive after putting their names into the flame but are flung across the room when the flame fires up. When they get up they have full heads of grey hair and beards.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Luna, Neville, and Ginny are seated on a train when suddenly they are fired on, and Molly and others approach. The wizard appears at their door, and Neville sees he hasn't enough money as Pansy Parkinson walks up to the trolley. Luna and Pansy look at each other and smile. Ginny sees Luna rubbing her head. Four flying foxes pulling a carriage land at Hogwarts, and the crowds cheer. A large dragon emerges from under the water and approaches too. A student runs up the aisle limping comically, whispers to Snape, and leaves the same way. A group of house-elves dressed in blue dance up the aisle and release butterflies, bow, and everyone applauds. A series of older witches walk up the aisle, brandishing bo staffs with sparks, and breathe fire. They embrace. The goblin seated next to Firenze yelps when Firenze stabs a fork into his hand. A strange house-elf stands in the doorway, casts magic upwards to seal the roof, and peace is restored. This creature enters the room and begins walking, seeing Luna through his mechanical eye. He limps, breathing heavily as the crowd is unsettled and booing. Snape casts magic over a box which melds into a goblet containing a blue flame. A suspicious creature enters the room where the goblet burns and closes the door. He writes his name on the board as Kreacher throws the chalk in anger, pops open a jar with a spider, and uses his wand to send it around the class, unsettling them. Seamus laughs, and Kreacher sends the spider onto Seamus's face. Kreacher has the spider over a bucket of water, and it's wriggling as Crabbe stands. Kreacher begins torturing the spider with magic, it squeals, and Kreacher stops. Crabbe is disturbed, and Kreacher picks up the spider, which is still making a noise. Ginny shakes her head as Kreacher casts a spell and the spider disintegrates. He approaches Luna's desk and takes a drink. They see a student on the stairs facing the window, and Kreacher approaches Crabbe, patting him on the shoulder. Crabbe nods. Younger students place their names into the flame, and others applaud, with Colin among them. The pixies come up cheering, jump inside the age line, do a high-five after putting their names into the flame, but are flung across the room when the flame fires up. When they get up, they have full heads of grey hair and beards.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are seated on a plane when suddenly they are fired on, and Arthur and others approach. The gentleman appears at their door, and Ron sees he hasn't enough tokens as Cho Chan walks up to the vending machine. Harry and Cho look at each other and smile. Hermione sees Harry rubbing his knee. Four flying camels pulling a sleigh land at Hogwarts, and the crowds cheer. A large submarine emerges from under the sand and approaches too. A man runs up the aisle limping comically, whispers to Dumbledore, and leaves the same way. A group of girls dressed in green dance up the aisle and release doves, bow, and everyone applauds. A series of older boys walk up the aisle, brandishing light sabers with sparks, and breathe fire. They embrace. The man seated next to Hagrid yelps when Hagrid stabs a spoon into his hand. A strange man stands in the doorway, casts magic upwards to seal the window, and peace is restored. This character enters the room and begins walking, seeing Harry through his mechanical ear. He limps, breathing heavily as the crowd is unsettled and booing. Dumbledore casts magic over a barrel which melds into a chalice containing a green flame. A suspicious character enters the room where the chalice burns and closes the door. He writes his name on the wall as Mad-Eye throws the feather in anger, pops open a can with a beetle, and uses his wand to send it around the class, unsettling them. Draco laughs, and Mad-Eye sends the beetle onto Draco's face. Mad-Eye has the beetle over a pot of oil, and it's wriggling as Neville Longbottom stands. Mad-Eye begins torturing the beetle with magic, it squeals, and Mad-Eye stops. Neville is disturbed, and Mad-Eye picks up the beetle, which is still making a noise. Hermione shakes her head as Mad-Eye casts a spell and the beetle disintegrates. He approaches Harry's desk and takes a bite. They see a boy on the stairs facing the painting, and Mad-Eye approaches Neville, patting him on the back. Neville nods. Older students place their names into the flame, and others applaud, with Cedric among them. The twins come up cheering, jump inside the age fence, do a high-five after putting their names into the flame, but are flung across the room when the flame fires up. When they get up, they have full heads of rainbow hair and beards.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are lounging on a train when suddenly they are sung to, and Arthur and others retreat. The lady stares at their door, and Ron finds he hasn't enough courage as Cho Chan dances up to the trolley. Harry and Cho gaze at each other and wink. Hermione notices Harry scratching his elbow. Four floating turtles pushing a carriage hover at Hogwarts, and the crowds murmur. A large ship sinks under the water and departs too. A man skips up the aisle hopping comically, croons to Dumbledore, and exits the same way. A group of girls dressed in blue tiptoe up the aisle and release doves, curtsy, and everyone gasps. A series of older boys leap up the aisle, twirling bo staffs with confetti, and juggle watermelons. They giggle. The man seated next to Hagrid chuckles when Hagrid flicks a fork into his hand. A strange man kneels in the doorway, draws magic downwards to open the roof, and chaos erupts. This character skips into the room and begins sliding, noticing Harry through his mechanical eye. He hops, wheezing softly as the crowd is entertained and clapping. Dumbledore draws magic over a box which transforms into a goblet containing a red flame. A suspicious character exits the room where the goblet flickers and opens the door. He scribbles his name on the board as Mad-Eye launches the chalk in excitement, seals open a jar with a spider, and uses his wand to bounce it around the class, amusing them. Draco chuckles, and Mad-Eye flings the spider onto Draco's lap. Mad-Eye dangles the spider over a pillow of feathers, and it's squirming as Neville Longbottom crouches. Mad-Eye starts complimenting the spider with magic, it giggles, and Mad-Eye halts. Neville is intrigued, and Mad-Eye lifts the spider, which is still humming a tune. Hermione nods as Mad-Eye murmurs a spell and the spider multiplies. He skips to Harry's desk and takes a gulp. They notice a boy on the stairs admiring the ceiling, and Mad-Eye skips to Neville, patting him on the back. Neville grins. Older students toss their names into the flame, and others cheer, with Cedric among them. The twins skip up applauding, somersault inside the age line, do a cartwheel after nudging their names into the flame, but are flung across the room when the flame bursts out. When they stand, they have full heads of golden hair and crowns.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Frank, Lily, and Sarah are seated on a bicycle when suddenly they are fired on, and George and others approach. The magician appears at their gate, and Lily sees she hasn't enough jewelry as Linda Lin strolls up to the kiosk. Frank and Linda look at each other and grin. Sarah sees Frank scratching his elbow. Four floating elephants dragging a wagon land at Springfield, and the crowds cheer. A giant balloon emerges from under the bridge and approaches too. A penguin runs up the corridor limping comically, whispers to Eisenhower, and leaves the same way. A band of chipmunks dressed in yellow dance up the corridor and release fireflies, bow, and everyone applauds. A series of young monkeys walk up the corridor, brandishing umbrellas with sparks, and breathe ice. They embrace. The panda seated next to Columbus yelps when Columbus stabs a spoon into his paw. A bizarre octopus stands in the archway, casts music upwards to seal the ceiling, and harmony is restored. This creature enters the tent and begins strolling, seeing Frank through his metallic binoculars. He limps, breathing heavily as the audience is unsettled and booing. Eisenhower casts music over an aquarium which melds into a chalice containing a red flame. A mysterious creature enters the tent where the chalice burns and closes the curtain. He writes his nickname on the wall as Cyclops throws the eraser in anger, pops open a jar with a cricket, and uses his baton to send it around the workshop, unsettling them. Percy laughs, and Cyclops sends the cricket onto Percy's nose. Cyclops has the cricket over a bowl of paint, and it's wriggling as Oliver Bumblebee stands. Cyclops begins tormenting the cricket with music, it squeals, and Cyclops stops. Oliver is distressed, and Cyclops picks up the cricket, which is still creating a noise. Sarah shakes her head as Cyclops casts a tune and the cricket evaporates. He approaches Frank's chair and takes a sip. They see a squirrel on the roof facing the river, and Cyclops approaches Oliver, patting him on the knee. Oliver nods. Young insects place their nicknames into the flame, and others cheer, with Ingrid among them. The otters come up hooting, leap inside the age circle, do a high-five after placing their nicknames into the flame, but are flung across the cave when the flame bursts up. When they get up, they have full coats of red feathers and antlers.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Percy, Luna, and Ginny are reclining on a boat when suddenly they are sung to, and Molly and others dance. The gentleman appears at their window, and Luna notices she hasn't enough paper as Padma Patil skips up to the kiosk. Percy and Padma glance at each other and chuckle. Ginny notices Percy scratching his arm. Four swimming dolphins towing a raft arrive at Beauxbatons, and the crowds applaud. A massive balloon ascends from above the ground and floats by too. A woman prances up the corridor balancing humorously, sings to McGonagall, and exits the same way. A troop of boys dressed in red cartwheel up the aisle and release doves, grin, and everyone cheers. A series of elderly women dance up the aisle, twirling umbrellas with sparks, and juggling fruit. They laugh. The lady reclining next to Sprout gasps when Sprout drops a spoon into her lap. A peculiar woman stands in the doorway, whistles quietly to sweep the floor, and harmony is restored. This figure exits the room and begins dancing, noticing Percy through her cloudy lens. She prances, humming to herself as the audience is ruffled and booing. McGonagall whispers gently over a basket which morphs into a goblet containing a green mist. An unsuspecting creature exits the room where the goblet glows and opens the window. She scribbles her name on the wall as Moody hurls the chalk in delight, pops open a canister with an insect, and taps his shoe to let it fly around the hall, intriguing them. Crabbe giggles, and Moody guides the insect onto Crabbe's ear. Moody holds the insect over a bowl of sand, and it's fluttering as Percy Weasley kneels. Moody begins serenading the insect with melody, it twitters, and Moody halts. Percy is intrigued, and Moody picks up the insect, which is still chirping. Ginny nods her head as Moody sings a tune and the insect vanishes. He nears Percy's table and takes a bite. They notice a girl on the ladder facing the doorway, and Moody nears Percy, singing to him softly. Percy agrees. Younger students toss their hats into the mist, and others holler, with Fleur among them. The sisters dance up laughing, leap outside the boundary, share a secret after throwing their hats into the mist, but are spun across the hallway when the mist swells up. When they stand, they sport full cloaks of silver feathers and wings.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are seated on a canoe when suddenly they are waved at, and Arthur and others amble over. The gentleman appears at their door, and Ron sees he hasn’t enough marbles as Cho Chan drifts up to the stand. Harry and Cho glance at each other and chuckle. Hermione observes Harry patting his elbow. Four swooping pigeons towing a cart settle at Hogwarts, and the crowds holler. A large balloon rises from beneath the ground and drifts closer. A man skips up the corridor with exaggerated steps, mutters to Dumbledore, and exits in a similar fashion. A group of girls dressed in yellow glide up the corridor and release confetti, curtsy, and everyone cheers. A series of older boys march up the corridor, holding umbrellas with fireworks, and exhale smoke. They high-five. The man seated next to Hagrid gasps when Hagrid pokes a toothpick into his foot. A peculiar man stands in the doorway, releases a spell sideways to fill the floor, and calmness is restored. This character enters the chamber and begins skipping, noticing Harry through his glass eye. He hops, wheezing as the crowd is startled and murmuring. Dumbledore scatters magic across a box which morphs into a chalice containing a green light. A dubious character strolls into the chamber where the chalice glows and shuts the door. He scribbles his name on the wall as Mad-Eye tosses the eraser in frustration, cracks open a bottle with a grasshopper, and uses his wand to slide it around the room, unnerving them. Draco snickers, and Mad-Eye flicks the grasshopper onto Draco's hair. Mad-Eye balances the grasshopper over a cup of juice, and it’s twisting as Neville Longbottom sits. Mad-Eye starts bouncing the grasshopper with magic, it giggles, and Mad-Eye halts. Neville is puzzled, and Mad-Eye grabs the grasshopper, which is still humming. Hermione tilts her head as Mad-Eye chants a spell and the grasshopper evaporates. He reaches Harry’s table and grabs a snack. They notice a girl on the ladder facing the curtain, and Mad-Eye nears Neville, tapping him on the elbow. Neville grins. Older students throw their scarves into the light, and others cheer, with Cedric among them. The twins trot up exclaiming, hop outside the circle, do a fist bump after tossing their scarves into the light, but are flung across the hall when the light flares up. When they rise, they have full heads of orange hair and antlers.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Gertrude, Felix, and Melinda are lounging on a boat when suddenly they are snowed on, and Gregory and monkeys stroll by. The pirate bursts at their window, and Felix notices he lacks enough coins as Luna Lynn strolls to the wagon. Gertrude and Luna glance at each other and giggle. Melinda notices Gertrude scratching her nose. Six hovering camels towing a sled touch down at Neverland, and the throngs roar. An enormous submarine rises from beneath the ground and drifts along, too. A jester trots across the meadow skipping clumsily, murmurs to Gandalf, and skips away the same way. A troupe of chipmunks dressed in yellow prance across the meadow and unleash doves, curtsy, and everyone cheers. A parade of young frogs hop across the meadow, twirling batons with fireworks, and exhale smoke. They chuckle. The dragon perched next to Olaf chirps when Olaf plunges a spoon into his tail. A peculiar creature hovers in the portal, channels sorcery sideways to seal the floor, and calm is restored. This entity glides into the cave and commences leaping, glimpsing Gertrude through its robotic iris. It hops, wheezing loudly as the assembly is perturbed and jeering. Gandalf channels sorcery over a drawer which morphs into a vase containing a pink glow. A dubious entity glides into the cave where the vase flickers and shuts the curtain. It scribbles its initials on the plank as Sleepy-Eye hurls the marker in rage, snaps open a jar with a beetle, and wields its staff to propel it around the assembly, startling them. Julian chuckles, and Sleepy-Eye directs the beetle onto Julian's nose. Sleepy-Eye dangles the beetle above a bowl of juice, and it's squirming as Beverly Blueberry rises. Sleepy-Eye initiates tormenting the beetle with sorcery, it howls, and Sleepy-Eye pauses. Beverly is distressed, and Sleepy-Eye lifts the beetle, which is still buzzing. Melinda shakes her fist as Sleepy-Eye chants a hex and the beetle vaporizes. It strides to Gertrude's bench and grabs a snack. They spot a girl on the escalator facing the mirror, and Sleepy-Eye strides to Beverly, patting her on the elbow. Beverly shrugs. Senior jesters toss their initials into the glow, and others cheer, with Martin among them. The siblings leap forward clapping, spring beyond the age circle, perform a chest-bump after tossing their initials into the glow, but are hurled across the cavern when the glow flares up. When they collect themselves, they have full crowns of white wool and mustaches.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are on a train, where Ron realizes he lacks money as Cho approaches, leading to a smile exchange between her and Harry. At Hogwarts, flying horses and a ship arrive, and performances by students create a festive atmosphere. Dumbledore uses magic on a goblet with a blue flame, hinting at a significant event. Mad-Eye Moody appears, causing unrest with his intense demeanor and magical antics, including unsettling Neville by torturing a spider. The goblet becomes the center of attention as students, including Cedric, place their names inside. The Weasley twins attempt to bypass the age restriction and end up humorously aged.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: When they get up they have full heads of grey hair and beards The twins come up cheering jump inside the age line do a highfive after putting their names into the flame but are flung across the room when the flame fires up Older students place their names into the flame and others applaud with Cedric among them Neville nods They see a boy on the stairs facing the window and MadEye approaches Neville patting him on the shoulder He approaches Harry's desk and takes a drink Hermione shakes her head as MadEye casts a spell and the spider disintegrates Neville is disturbed and MadEye picks up the spider which is still making a noise it squeals and MadEye stops MadEye begins torturing the spider with magic MadEye has the spider over a bucket of water and it is wriggling as Neville Longbottom stands Draco laughs and MadEye sends the spider onto Draco's face He writes his name on the board as MadEye throws the chalk in anger pops open a jar with a spider and uses his wand to send it around the class unsettling them A suspicious character enters the room where the goblet burns and closes the door Dumbledore casts magic over a box which melds into a goblet test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: MadEye has the spider over a bucket of water and it is wriggling as Neville Longbottom stands Dumbledore casts magic over a box which melds into a goblet containing a blue flame The man seated next to Hagrid yelps when Hagrid stabs a fork into his hand Hermione shakes her head as MadEye casts a spell and the spider disintegrates Neville is disturbed and MadEye picks up the spider which is still making a noise A man runs up the aisle limping comically whispers to Dumbledore and leaves the same way A large ship emerges from under the water and approaches too This character enters the room and begins walking seeing Harry through his mechanical eye A strange man stands in the doorway casts magic upwards to seal the roof and peace is restored A suspicious character enters the room where the goblet burns and closes the door They embrace They see a boy on the stairs facing the window and MadEye approaches Neville patting him on the shoulder MadEye begins torturing the spider with magic When they get up they have full heads of grey hair and beards He writes his name on the board as MadEye throws the chalk in anger pops open a jar with a spider and uses his wand to send it around the class unsettling them Older students place their names into the flame and others applaud with Cedric among them The lady appears at their door and Ron sees he has not enough money as Cho Chan walks up to the trolley He limps breathing heavily as the crowd is unsettled and booing Harry and Cho look at each other and smile Draco laughs and MadEye sends the spider onto Draco's face The twins come up cheering jump inside the age line do a highfive after putting their names into the flame but are flung across the room when the flame fires up Four flying horses pulling a carriage land at Hogwarts and the crowds cheer Neville nods A group of girls dressed in blue dance up the aisle and release butterflies bow and everyone applauds A series of older boys walk up the aisle brandishing bo staffs with sparks and breathe fire He approaches Harry's desk and takes a drink Harry Ron and Hermione are seated on a train when suddenly they are fired on and Arthur and others approach Hermione sees Harry rubbing his head it squeals and MadEye stops
